results.title: Eat a bowl of tea
results.creator_credit: American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Columbia Pictures, Tom Sternberg and Wayne Wong
results.brief_description: Set between 1949-1951, Wayne Wong’s Capra-style comedy centers on an arranged marriage in New York’s Chinatown. The marriage is a romantic and emotional success until it comes under well-intended but intolerable pressures from the Chinese-American community. The film asks how a young couple can cope when there are few role models at hand and they are isolated from their parents. It also shows the drastic effect of the endless pressure from family and friends to bear children. The tone however remains light, and while broaching serious political and social issues, the film uses laughter rather than anger to highlight these. English and Cantonese dialogue with some English subtitles.

results.title: Easygoing: transport services for people with special needs
results.brief_description: This video provides important and practical information on the facilities available to assist people with special needs in using Victorian public transport. Through stories of five public transport users, the video highlights the varied services for improved access to public transport and outlines the plans to further improve access in the years ahead.

results.title: Easy way out
results.creator_credit: ACI Films, Temple Stemm and Sherman Beck
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for a constructive approach to drugs and alcohol. Through a novel analogy between the physical effort needed by chicks to hatch from eggs and the psychological effort needed by adolescents to mature, the viewer learns that struggle develops strength.

results.title: Easy virtue
results.creator_credit: Gainsborough Pictures, M Woolf, Sir Michael Balcon and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Based on the play by Noel Coward, Hitchcock’s version of what Coward intended as a comedy was produced as a melodrama. Larita Filton, a married woman, falls in love with a young artist. When he suicides, Larita divorces her drunken husband and travels abroad. There she meets John Whittaker who knows nothing of her past. His mother finds out the truth about Larita and compells John to divorce her. Hitchock appears in this film strolling past a tennis court. It is a must see for Hitchcock film buffs.

results.title: Easy street [Silent version]
results.brief_description: The Tramp, played by Chaplin, reformed by angelic Edna Purviance, joins the police force and his first job is to tame the local bully (Eric Campbell). Also features Albert Austin and Henry Bergman.

results.brief_description: The Tramp, played by Chaplin, reformed by angelic Edna Purviance, joins the police force and his first job is to tame the local bully (Eric Campbell). results.title: Easy self defence
results.brief_description: Shows how women can defend themselves in various situations if attacked by a male. Re-enacts typical spots where women are attacked - parks, car parks, poorly-lit areas - and then demostrates various types of movements that will de-mobilize the attacker and enable the woman to make a run for it.

results.title: Easy rider [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Peter Fonda and Dennis Hopper
results.brief_description: This is a digitally remastered 30th anniversary collector’s edition of the modern classic tale of two carefree young men who take a leisurely motorcycle ride across the southern United States after concluding a drug deal to pay expenses. With an exceptional performance by Jack Nicholson as an alcoholic lawyer, the cast also includes Peter Fonda and Dennis Hopper.

results.title: Easy does it
results.creator_credit: Tasfilm Productions, Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry and Don Anderson
results.brief_description:
This 1967 film is a light-hearted look at the correct methods of manual handling in order to avoid back strain and injury. The film shows footage of factory and manual labourers handling various heavy loads, including using equipment to aid safe lifting. This footage is interspersed with examples of everyday strain such as women hanging out the washing and lifting a baby from a pram; and moments of slapstick comedy as a man struggles to carry his bride over the threshold of their house and a man lifts a keg of beer at a barbeque.

Produced by Tasfilm Productions for the Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Eastern victory
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, John Elliot and Philip Dorte
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “War in the Air”.
The three further phases of the air war in the Far East (1943-45). First, the air campaign in Burma. Second, the Pacific air actions leading to the bombing of Tokyo; the third, the atomic bomb, the surrender of Japan, and the resumption of air traffic in the Far East.
